title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message:
Hello everyone, have this board in and it already been verified by some one who found this chip is blown and removed it
Not sure what the original issue was.
Is there any point in trying to replace it or just scrap the board because ssd will be bad by now?


Any places to get this chip?

Thank you!

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message:
Liquid spill on the video connector is the first cause.
Inspect for corrosion MLB connector and the one from T-CON also.

You can get U9850 from scrap board, or Aliexpress.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://es.aliexpress.com/premium/CBTL06142EEE.html?d=y&origin=y&catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20220128004758&SearchText=CBTL06142EEE[/URL]

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message: Hello [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER], but u9580 should be TPS62180

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message:
Oooops, I got confused with U9850, sorry.

[URL unfurl="true"]https://es.aliexpress.com/af/tps62180.html?d=y&origin=n&SearchText=tps62180&catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20220128080813[/URL]
or scrap board, if available.

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message:
Oh, forgot to mention:
L9580 and L9581 are shorted to ground...

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message: If short persists after U9580 is removed, then dead SSD...

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message: Any ways to replace those ssd? Any ways to get them?

title: 820-01700 blown u9580
message:
Some people claimed on Internet they have changed the NANDs.
We have few threads about same question on the forum; nobody left a feedback about did it, or not.
